column4: i can access the internet but i cannot add any applications on ubuntu, what seems to be the problem?
i have no idea how to use synaptic, i'm very new to ubuntu

synaptic is another way of installing things.. in ubuntu you can install software by using the Add/Remove-menu, by using synaptic, or by using the command line with apt-get.. there are others too but these are the most common ones.. in the menu "system, administration, synaptic package manager"
yeah I have it opened but now what?
what program did you want to install?
press the search button.. type in "wireless assistant" and ok
hmm... what's odd.. if you search for say.. "linux" do you still get 0 hits?
i get a lot of results for linux
ok.. in the settings menu in synaptic, press "repositories"
the main goal im getting at is wireless connectivity, should i be downloading ndviswrapper instead?
I'm not sure.. I don't run wireless myself.. but we'll find your wireless assistant package, don't worry
ok, so i'm at the repository
you can enable all the different repositories there.. make sure there is a checkmark before each one of them..
press close.. you might get a dialog window that says it needs to update the list.. do that
